info.title: Enabling IPv6 router advertisement for PXE clients

abstract.para: This section describes how to enable basic IPv6 router advertisement and address assignment functionality for PXE clients in networks that rely on Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC).

note.title: Only required in IPv6 or dual-stack networks
note.para: Configure IPv6 router advertisement only if PXE clients are expected to receive IPv6 addresses or operate in an IPv6-only or dual-stack environment. For purely IPv4 deployments, this step is not necessary.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: To support PXE booting in IPv6-enabled environments, the PXE server must provide basic router advertisement functionality to inform clients of the network prefix. This is especially necessary in setups using Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC) instead of DHCPv6.
